page.title: 05FARMING SHIRE HORSES
page.content: The most interesting farm in the area is Saredon Hall,a mixed farm of 400 acres where the owner has been breeding shire horses for 21 years.At the present time he has 17 shires and has won many awards at the annual Shire Horse Show at Peterborough.His 3 year old filly "Pure Gold" won the best mare in Britain 1981.The horses are kept outside and graze happily with the cattle and sheep.They are used on the farm to cart feed to the other animals, to harrow and for light haulage.The farmer has a complete set of horse drawn implements for use on the farm. The foals are sold mainly at home but have been exported to Ireland, Canada and America."Sandringham Snowflake" by his stallion "Saredon Emperor" was exported by the Queen to America.
